<answer>



I begin cooking dinner at 5 PM so that it is ready for consuming my 6 PM.  Tonite, I will be piercing a spaghetti squash before cutting it in half around the short middle; remove the seeds; place each half upside down on a pan lined with foil.  Bake for 50 minutes at 400 degrees.  When baked, remove from the oven and using a fork, remove the veggie from the rind onto a dinner plate.  Serve with half a can of Wolf brand beanless chili (or turkey chili) scooped onto the top of the squash.



</answer>

<answer from>

Member since: 11 October 2007
Total points: 24781 (Level 6)



Contributing In:

</answer from>



<answer>



4 teaspoons Salt
4 teaspoons Paprika
3 teaspoons Garlic powder
3 teaspoons Fr. ground pepper
2 1/2 teaspoons Onion powder
1 1/2 teaspoon Cayenne pepper
1 1/2 teaspoon Dried thyme -- crumbled
1 1/2 teaspoon Dried oregano -- crumbled



mix altogether and store in a air tight container



</answer>

<answer>



At 5 am I just made KELLOGG'S RICE KRISPIES TREATS for my daughter to take to school today!



1/4 cup butter
1 (10 oz., about 40) pkg. regular marshmallows or 3 cups miniature marshmallows
6 cups Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal



MICROWAVE DIRECTIONS:



Microwave butter with marshmallows on high setting for 2 minutes in a microwave safe mixing bowl. Stir together when melted. Microwave again on high for 1 additional minute. Stir in cereal, mixing until well coated. Press into pan as above.



Source(s):



http://www.cooks.com/rec/view/0,1842,150...



</answer>

<answer from>



Master of My Own Remote Control!
Member since: 10 January 2007
Total points: 1698 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Cooking & Recipes



</answer from>



<answer>



Just posted this, so am pasting ;)  ENJOY!



I am a total scratch cook, but also do not fancy sweets (chilehead!). Therefore, when I needed a sweet treat for a party, I called my sister for a recipe, and this is what I made. It was the bomb, super easy, and I have made it several times since with rave reviews.



KAHLUA CAKE



Cake:



1 package yellow cake mix
1 package (4 cups) chocolate instant pudding mix (unprepared)
1 cup vegetable oil
4 eggs
1/2 cup Kahlua
1/2 cup water
1-1/2 cups chocolate chips



Mix all ingredients and pour into a bundt pan. Bake at 325 for 45-55 minutes.



Icing:



1 cup powdered sugar
1-3 tablespoons Kahlua



Mix with a little water if you want to go easier on the Kahlua (not in my house!), and drizzle on cooled cake. You want a thick consistency.



YUMMMMMY!!!



Source(s):



My Beautiful Sister ;)



</answer>

<answer from>



Ebony P
Member since: 18 June 2008
Total points: 1825 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



My Shrimp Soup
Serves 4



4 packages of Top Ramen Shrimp flavored soups
1 lb of frozen shrimp
1 bunch of green onions, sliced
1 package of sliced mushrooms, any kind
1 box of vegetable broth
crushed red pepper
salt and pepper
rice wine vinegar
1 lemon sliced
sliced cabbage



Using doubled aluminum foil, make four packages to hold individual servings.  Place one serving of noodles in each package.  Top with a layer of mushrooms, lemon slices, frozen shrimp, green onion, and cabbage.  Pour enough broth over to cover and add a few dashes of rice wine vinegar, season with salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes.  Put packets over medium heat on the grill and cook for about 6-8 minutes.  Serve in bowls with egg rolls.



</answer>



<answer from>



Luv2Cook
Member since: 22 April 2008
Total points: 7207 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Cooking & Recipes



</answer from>



<answer>



This one is good.



Grilled Shrimp Skewers
with Lemon Garlic Sauce



18 large shrimp, peeled & deveined, tails on
6 Bamboo skewers
1/2 cup butter
2 garlic cloves minced
1 tbs fresh lemon juice
zest from 1/2 lemon
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp white pepper
2 tbs chopped flat-leaf parsley



Soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes,
prevents open ends from burning.



Melt butter in sauce pan on low heat, add garlic,
lemon juice and zest. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir
in salt, pepper & parsley. Turn off heat.



Thread 3 shrimp on each skewer, tails facing
in one direction, leave a little space between. Brush
lemon butter sauce on side you will place face down
on grill. Cook 3 minutes. Brush sauce on side facing up,
turn with tongs, cook 3 minutes. Remove from grill
brush again with butter sauce....want the shrimp
dripping in this sauce!



Source(s):



http://www.cooking-is-easy-and-fun.com



</answer>



<answer from>



sunflowe...
Member since: 17 May 2006
Total points: 5293 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Cooking & Recipes



</answer from>



<answer>



Caramelized Garlic Shrimp



______________________________________...
Ingredients
GARLIC:



1/2 teaspoon kosher salt



20 garlic cloves, peeled



Cooking spray



SHRIMP:



2 teaspoons olive oil



1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined



1 teaspoon butter



3/4 cup half-and-half



1/2 cup fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth



¾ cup  grated Parmesan cheese



1/4 teaspoon salt



1/8 teaspoon black pepper



2 cups frozen loose-leaf spinach, thawed, drained, and squeezed dry



4 cups hot cooked linguine (about 8 ounces uncooked pasta)



Preparation
Preheat oven to 350°.



To prepare garlic, combine 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and garlic in a bowl. Place garlic mixture on a jelly-roll pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally.



To prepare shrimp, heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp; sauté 3 minutes or until done. Remove shrimp from pan.



Melt butter in pan over medium heat. Stir in half-and-half, broth, cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and black pepper. Cook 1 minute or until cheese melts, stirring constantly. Stir in shrimp and spinach; cook 1 minute. Combine shrimp mixture, garlic mixture, and pasta in a large bowl; toss well. Serve immediately.



</answer>

<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



We did a Pork Crown Roast one year to change up the Christmas Dinner. we did make a stuffing for the center of the roast, but for us we added sausage, apples,celery, cranberries. Usually we have cornbread dressing or regular stuffing or Mom brings Oyster Dressing. You can add tons of stuff to the stuffing for making it different. Another year we did a Lamb Crown Roast. H-man
Member since: 30 April 2007
Total points: 82956 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Cooking & Recipes



Yahoo! Answers



</answer from>



<answer>



Strawberry Soup



Serves 6



This one is a dessert soup. It's a novel way to use sweet and juicy Quebec strawberries when they are in season. Cranberry juice could replace the yogurt for a clearer, non-dairy soup.



1 pint strawberries, washed, hulled and cut in half



1 cup (250 mL) low-fat vanilla yogurt



1/2 cup (125 mL) cold water



1 teaspoon (5 mL) balsamic vinegar, plus a little extra for serving



Mint sprigs, for garnish



Puree strawberries, yogurt, water and 1 teaspoon (5 mL) balsamic vinegar in a blender until smooth. Chill until cold.



Serve in small stemmed glasses or transparent dessert bowls. Garnish with a drizzle of balsamic vinegar and a sprig of mint.



</answer>



<answer from>

Total points: 366 (Level 2)

<question>



Is it ok to cook pearl barley in a slow cooker?



Or does it need a higher heat?



</question>



<answer from>



Classy Granny
Member since: 07 June 2006
Total points: 38287 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Pearl barley cooks great in a slow cooker. I add a big handful to vegetable soup every time I make it.



</answer>



<answer from>



viciousl...
Member since: 07 September 2006
Total points: 366 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



it's fine in a slow cooker, but you may need to top up with water to keep the stuff moist, when it drys out it tastes like sugarpuffs!



I add it to casseroles and soups, adds a different texture to it all!



</answer>

<question>



How do you make a raspberry coulis?



I know you use caster sugar but just don't know how long to boil the raspberries for etc??!!!!



</question>
